text: It'd probably need to be a different menu layout - I'd guess the intent of this is to keep users from poor color choices, with a better user experience than just making the colors radio select options

Just wanted to give this guy a little bit of love, since I'm running into a big need for this on a project - <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/A-B-Testing-Forms/idi-p/11502/> It'd be so great to be able to test variants in Popup/Slide-in forms :smiling_face_with_tear:

Did we ever end up with a post for this in the HS community forum? I know there are other things happening, but every time someone press tab after writing '.class' and it doesn't do anything, a baby hamster cries a single tear :smiling_face_with_tear:
I made an idea post for this a few months ago if anyone feels like upvoting there, too :slightly_smiling_face: - <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Fixed-Fields-Menu/idi-p/628148>
The theme settings can control the bulk of the module colors, it's up to the theme developer to allow overrides, so I think it really depends on how the theme is coded
Sometimes you may want to give a client the option of only a handful of brand colors, and it is not as nice of a user experience to make them select select from a drop down vs a nice color palette
I can see where that would be helpful, if it is the color picker itself that gets the overhaul, vs having every theme/module make an update to allow for it
Yeah, maybe having options like, "full color picker", "theme colors only", and "select colors" or something might be a reasonable way to do it
